Common.CommunityEditionBanner: Welcome to AdminUI Community Edition. This is a free version of the AdminUI tool for administering IdentityServer configuration and users. It is limited to 10 users and 2 clients. To find out more about the full AdminUI product, click on the link below
Common.CommunityPolicyNotice: This is a preview of the Access Policy screen. In Community Edition the Access Policy features have been removed. You can use the screen but none of the policies will take effect. To find out more about the full AdminUI product, click on the link below

Resources.DescriptionHelp: Resource description that will be seen on consent screens
Resources.AssignClaims: Assign user claim types to be included in tokens
Resources.UniqueIdentifier: The unique identifier for this resource
Resources.ResourceName: Resource name used within Admin UI
Resources.ResourceDescription: Resource description used within Admin UI

Scope.DisplayName: Scope name that will be seen on consent screens
Scope.Description: Scope description that will be seen on consent screens
Scope.Consent: Consent to use scope is required to complete authentication
Scope.EmphasiseScope: Emphasize scope name on consent screen
Scope.UserClaimTypes: User claim types to be included in tokens. Claims types will be added to the list of claim types for the parent resource.

IdentityResources.Title: Identity Resources
IdentityResources.UserClaimTypes: User claim types to be included in tokens
IdentityResources.IDHelp: The unique identifier for this resource. Used in requests
IdentityResources.DisplayNameHelp: Resource name that will be seen on consent screens

you to the resource details
IdentityResources.ResourceReservedHelp: This resource is reserved and cannot be edited

ProtectedResources.Title: Protected Resource
ProtectedResources.AssignClaims: Assign user claim types to be included in the token
ProtectedResources.UserClaimTypes: User claim types to be included in tokens. Applies to all scopes for the resource.
ProtectedResources.ClientAccess: Select the Protected Resources this client can access

Clients.Title: Client
Clients.IDHelp: The unique identifier for this application
Clients.Review: A chance to review before submitting
Clients.DisplayNameHelp: Application name that will be seen on consent screens
Clients.DisplayURLHelp: Application URL that will be seen on consent screens
Clients.LogoURLHelp: Application Logo that will be seen on consent screens. Must be HTTPS
Clients.DescriptionHelp: Application description for use within Admin UI
Clients.CallbackURL:
Enter a Callback URL
(Tokens will be sent to this endpoint. You can configure more after setup)
Clients.PostLogoutURL:
Enter a Post-Logout URL
(Optional. You can configure more after setup)
Clients.RedirectURLDescription: Full path of redirect URL. Must be HTTPS in production
Clients.LogoutURLDescription: Users can be returned to this URL after logging out. Must be HTTPS in production
Clients.IdentityResourcesAccess: Select the Identity Resources this client can access
Clients.ProtectedResourcesAccess: Select the Protected Resources this client can access
Clients.SelectType: Select the type of application you want to create
Clients.StaticClaims: Static claims returned in access tokens for this client application. By default these claims are only sent with the Client Credentials grant type.
Clients.NoClaims: No claims found for this client. Add some using the form above.
Clients.AllowClaims: Allow client claims to be sent for all grant types
Clients.PrefixClaims: Choose the text you would like to prefix claims with
Clients.Restrictions: Identity providers the client application can use. If empty, all providers are allowed. Reference by AuthorityScheme within IdentityServer.
Clients.NoRestrictions: No restrictions found for this client. Add some using the form above.
Clients.UnableToAddProperty: Unable to add property. Key already exists
Clients.TapRow:
Tapping on a row will take
you to the client details
Clients.Reserved: This client is reserved and cannot be edited
Clients.NoSecrets: Heads up! No secrets have been set. Use the form above to add one and it'll show up here.
Clients.CORSUrl: This Url is a path and cannot be a CORS Url
Clients.UrlIsPath: This Url is a path and cannot be a CORS Url

RequireConsent.Title: Require Consent?
RequireConsent.Help: Specifies whether a consent screen is required

AllowRememberConsent.Title: Remember Consent?
AllowRememberConsent.Help: Specifies whether consent screen is remembered after having been given

RequireSecret.Title: Require Secret?
RequireSecret.Help: Specifies whether a secret is required

Tokens.Title: Tokens
Tokens.UserSSOLifetimeTooltip: Amount of time between user authentication challenges. Defaults to the IdentityServer session lifetime
Tokens.UpdateAccessTokensSummary: Update access tokens (and its claims) when refresh token is used.
Tokens.UpdateAccessTokens: Update Access Token Claims On Refresh
Tokens.AccessTokensViaBrowser: Allow access tokens to be sent via browser. Disabling is useful for hardening flows that allow for multiple grant types.
Tokens.IncludeUserClaimsInIdToken: Always Include User Claims In Id Token

SPA.Title: Single Page App
SPA.Description:
A client-side application running in a browser.
These applications cannot be trusted to keep secrets or use refresh tokens.
Tokens will be sent through via the browser and will be visible to the user.

WebApp.Title: Web
WebApp.Description:
Server-side application that can be trusted to keep a secret and use refresh tokens.
Tokens will be sent to a back-end server and will not be visible to the user.

URLS.Title: Application URLs
URLS.SendTokens: Can send tokens to this URL
URLS.RedirectAfterLogout: Can redirect to this URL after logout
URLS.CORSDomain: Domain that can make cross-origin requests
URLS.URLAddUnsuccessful: There was a problem adding your URL

Secret Picker.LastWarning: Warning, you will not be able to access the value of this secret after adding it.
